snippet: The Manhattan district attorney’s office cashed a check for more than twice its total annual budget, and the money will go toward lowering crime and modernizing courtroom technology.
abstract: Federal and state authorities secure record $1.92 billion payment from HSBC Bank to settle charges that it transferred billions of dollars for nations under sanction by United States, enabling Mexican drug cartels to launder money through American financial system; Manhattan district attorney’s office will use money, more than twice its total annual budget, in efforts toward lowering crime and modernizing courtroom technology.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan district attorney’s office cashed a check for more than twice its total annual budget, and the money will go toward lowering crime and modernizing courtroom technology.

headline.main: Extra $169 Million Will Go to Public Safety
headline.print_headline: Extra $169 Million Will Go to Public Safety
